title: Domain 4.2: Explain the security implications of proper hardware, software, and data asset management.
content:
🛒 Acquisition/Procurement Process

  • Ensure vendors meet security standards before purchasing hardware/software—prevents supply chain vulnerabilities.

🧾 Assignment / Accounting

👤 Ownership

  • Assigns responsibility for each asset—ensures accountability and proper handling.

🗂️ Classification

  • Labels assets/data based on sensitivity (e.g., Public, Confidential, Critical)—drives access controls and handling rules.

🕵️ Monitoring / Asset Tracking

📦 Inventory

  • Maintain updated records of all assets—helps with audits, patching, and incident response.

🔢 Enumeration

  • Actively identify and catalog all devices connected to the network—detects unauthorized or rogue assets.

🗑️ Disposal / Decommissioning

🧼 Sanitization

  • Removes all data using secure methods (e.g., wiping, degaussing) before reuse or disposal.

💥 Destruction

  • Physically destroys storage media—final, irreversible method of data removal.

📜 Certification

  • Provides documented proof that disposal met compliance and security requirements.

📁 Data Retention

  • Defines how long data must be kept—based on legal, business, or regulatory needs.
